medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent episodes of acute epigastric pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has been in his usual state of health until approximately 6 months prior to admission when he started experiencing intermittent episodes of acute epigastric pain approximately every few weeks, lasting minutes, which progressed to occurring more frequently and lasting hours. Symptoms were associated with severe discomfort and pallor, and occurred while commuting to work. Following evaluations, the patient underwent an ERCP/EUS.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Essential hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Nephrolithiasis, Eosinophilia, Prolonged bleeding time.
medical_history.family_history: Father with stroke, Mother with meningitis.
